question_sentence: How many times had a US House of Representatives speaker been removed from the role prior to the ousting of Kevin McCarthy?
evidence: McCarthy made history on Tuesday by becoming the first House speaker to be voted out of the job, following a revolt by members of his own Republican Party, including Donald Trump. Florida congressman Matt Gaetz spearheaded the rebellion after McCarthy relied on Democratic votes to get a short-term spending deal passed to avert a government shutdown.

question_sentence: Infestations of which unwanted pest are causing panic across Paris?
evidence: Viral videos on social media appear to show bedbugs swarming inside the French capital's trains, subways, buses, cinemas and even at Charles-de-Gaulle airport. The authorities are under pressure to tackle the infestations before the city hosts the Olympics next summer, but experts say the tiny insects are on the rise worldwide.

question_sentence: Sharon White is to step down as chair of John Lewis after how many years in the role?
evidence: White announced she is to step down – making her the shortest-serving chair in John Lewis's history – after the retail group posted a £234 million loss in the last financial year. To find out more, listen to The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Customs agents at a Minnesota airport seized a box of giraffe poo from a woman who wanted to use the droppings to make what?
evidence: The unnamed Iowa woman, who was returning from Kenya, declared the small box of poo and explained her plan after her belongings were inspected at Minneapolis-Saint Paul airport. She told officials that she had previously made a necklace with moose faeces, but the border protection agency destroyed the giraffe droppings, citing their potential to spread disease.

question_sentence: Which Spanish city hosted the third European Political Community summit?
evidence: Some 50 European leaders gathered on Thursday for informal talks aimed at fostering cooperation, with Ukraine's application for EU membership high on the agenda.

question_sentence: How many of the six planned central towers on Barcelona's unfinished Sagrada Familia cathedral have now been completed?
evidence: This week saw the installation of the final sculptural piece on the tower of Matthew the Evangelist, followed by the crowning of the tower of John the Evangelist with the figure of an eagle. The Junta Constructora del Temple Expiatori de la Sagrada Família, which oversees the church's construction, is aiming to complete the planned central tower, which will represent Jesus, by 2026 – 144 years after building began.

question_sentence: Which Hollywood actor is warning fans to "beware" a video advert featuring an AI-generated version of him?
evidence: The Oscar winner told his 9.5 million Instagram followers that he had "nothing to do" with "a video out there promoting some dental plan with an AI version of me". The actor has previously spoken about the "artistic challenge" posed by the use of artificial intelligence in film and TV.

question_sentence: What will be the leading cause of cancer in women under 60 by 2030, according to a new study?
evidence: According to forecasts by Cancer Research UK, obesity will overtake smoking as the leading cause of cancer among women under 60 by 2030. The UK is "reaping the consequences" of a government failure to tackle rising rates of people being overweight and obese, said Katharine Jenner, director of the Obesity Health Alliance.

question_sentence: Which countries will host matches in the unprecedented six-nation 2030 FIFA World Cup?
choices: Bulgaria, Romania, Serbia, Greece, Denmark and Finland
Morocco, Portugal, Spain, Uruguay, Argentina and Paraguay
France, Ireland, UK, Germany, Sweden and Italy
Mexico, Canada, Brazil, Chile, South Africa and Egypt
evidence: In a controversial selection of six joint World Cup hosts for 2030, the majority of matches will be played in Morocco, Portugal and Spain, while Uruguay, Argentina and Paraguay will hold the opening three games.

question_sentence: Who won this year's Nobel Peace Prize?
evidence: The jailed Iranian women's rights activist was awarded the prize this week for her fight against the oppression of women in the country, and for her efforts in promoting human rights and freedom for all. The Nobel committee's decision to honour Mohammadi was widely applauded, but the awards have also triggered controversies over the years.

question_sentence: The largest health care strike in US history began this week. Around how many hospital employees walked off the job?
evidence: More than 75,000 unionized employees of Kaiser Permanente — around 40% of its total staff — took to the picket lines this week to demand better pay and benefits.

question_sentence: Which lawmaker was ousted from his role as speaker of the US House of Representatives?
evidence: Kevin McCarthy was voted out as House speaker. The other lawmakers above have emerged as possible successors to take over the gavel.

question_sentence: A recent letter from the Vatican appears to show Pope Francis may consider opening the door to blessing same-sex couples. Where is Vatican City located?
evidence: Pope Francis, the head of the Catholic Church in Vatican City, Italy, has suggested for the first time that some people in same-sex unions could be blessed by Catholic priests on a “case-by-case” basis. It is a reversal of previous statements in which the Pope said the Church could not bless same-sex unions, because they could “not bless sin.”

question_sentence: Which Satellite TV provider was hit with a $150,000 fine for failing to properly dispose of one of its satellites in space?
evidence: Dish Network was fined by the FCC for improper satellite disposal, marking the first time federal regulators have issued such a penalty for space junk.

question_sentence: Which famous figure was recently honored on a new US postage stamp?
evidence: The late Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg is featured on a new US postage stamp.

question_sentence: The CDC this week announced it will no longer distribute which item?
evidence: The CDC is no longer distributing Covid-19 vaccination cards, the white cards that were given out with vaccines earlier in the pandemic.

question_sentence: Democratic Sen. Laphonza Butler made history this week when she became the only Black woman presently serving in the Senate. Which state does she represent?
evidence: Laphonza Butler was appointed to fill the late Sen. Dianne Feinstein’s Senate seat in California.

question_sentence: Which organization was recently impacted by a cyberattack affecting its unclassified websites?
evidence: NATO says it is “actively addressing incidents” affecting its unclassified websites after a hacking group claimed to have stolen numerous strategic planning and research documents from the alliance.

question_sentence: Climate change is threatening to significantly impact the supply of which crop?
evidence: Climate change poses a huge threat to the coffee business and to farmers. Arabica coffee, the only variety used by Starbucks, is especially at risk.

question_sentence: Which type of pet belonging to President Joe Biden has been removed from the White House grounds after a series of biting incidents?
evidence: President Biden’s dog, Commander, is not presently at the White House after at least one playful bite turned into a concerning pattern.

question_sentence: During the game against the Miami Marlins, what did Phillies player Nick Castellanos do after hitting a double down the left field line in the fourth inning?
choices: Waved to the fans in the stands.
Flipped off his teammates using his ring finger.
Pointed to the sky in gratitude.

question_sentence: What is the minimum annual income required for a family of four to be considered middle class in Delaware in 2023, according to the study?
Which luxury watch company is opening a store at the Christiana Mall on November 15?
What was the original purpose of the Baal statue that stood near the Smyrna Rest Area in Delaware?
What sparked the popularity of Mexican pizza in Philadelphia?
choices: A chef's nostalgic return to his Italian restaurant roots
A local food competition promoting creative pizza recipes
The fusion of Mexican and Italian flavors by innovative chefs
The influence of Mexican-American fast-food chains

question_sentence: What is the primary reason for the endangered status of crowned lemurs?
What is the predicted record amount of consumer spending on Halloween costumes and decorations for the 2023 season?
Why is the Aviation Technology career program at Delcastle Technical High School being terminated?
choices: Lack of student interest and low enrollment
Budget constraints and lack of funding
Lack of qualified instructors and staffing issues

question_sentence: Who among the following individuals is a three-time state wrestling champion for Tatnall School and later became an All-American center in football at Alabama?
What is the main goal of the Melanated Mash Makers, a Delaware-based beer club formed by Black craft beer enthusiasts?
choices: To collaborate with breweries for special edition beers
To increase the presence of people of color in the Delaware craft beer world
To establish a brewery exclusively for Black craft beer enthusiasts
